extendedIngredients.name: grape tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pint cherry or grape tomatoes, halved
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pint cherry or grape tomatoes, halved

extendedIngredients.name: kale
extendedIngredients.original: 1 to 2 bunches kale (1 1/2 pounds), thick stems removed
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 to 2 bunches kale (1 1/2 pounds), thick stems removed
extendedIngredients.originalName: to 2 bunches kale , thick stems removed

extendedIngredients.name: lasagna noodles
extendedIngredients.original: 8 ounces lasagna noodles (about 9 noodles), each broken crosswise into 4 to 6 pieces
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 ounces lasagna noodles (about 9 noodles), each broken crosswise into 4 to 6 pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: lasagna noodles (about 9 noodles), each broken crosswise into 4 to 6 pieces

extendedIngredients.originalName: large onions, halved and thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.originalName: spicy Italian sausage, removed from casings and crumbled

title: Lasagna with Sausage and Kale
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a 5-quart pot, cook sausage over medium heat, stirring often, until browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in onions; cover, and cook until softened, 5 minutes. Uncover; cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Add garlic; cook 2 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl.Add kale and 1/2 cup water to pot; season with salt and pepper. Cover; cook over medium-low heat, tossing occasionally, until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain; coarsely chop. Transfer to bowl with onions.Meanwhile, cook noodles 2 minutes less than package instructions. Drain; rinse under cold water.Add noodles, tomatoes, and ricotta to the bowl; season with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Toss well. Pour into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish; smooth top with a spatula. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Bake until golden brown, about 40 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a 5-quart pot, cook sausage over medium heat, stirring often, until browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in onions; cover, and cook until softened, 5 minutes. Uncover; cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes.
Add kale and 1/2 cup water to pot; season with salt and pepper. Cover; cook over medium-low heat, tossing occasionally, until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
Transfer to bowl with onions.Meanwhile, cook noodles 2 minutes less than package instructions.
Add noodles, tomatoes, and ricotta to the bowl; season with 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Toss well.
Pour into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish; smooth top with a spatula. Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake until golden brown, about 40 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.
